body.p: CASE 257.—Private Philip Hill, Co. C, 46th Pennsylvania, was wounded at Cedar Mountain, August 9, 1862. He was admitted to Mansion House Hospital, Alexandria, August 15th, and, on August 30th, was transferred to York, Pennsylvania. Surgeon H. Palmer, U. S. V., reported that the ball entered the right natis and passed into the abdominal cavity, wounding the great intestines. Fæcal matter escaped from the wound for several days. Hill was discharge the service, November 14, 1862, for total disability. His name is not upon the Pension List.
